clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Project to Distribute Water Filters and Cookstoves in Western Rwanda
clinical_study.official_title: ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF WATER FILTERS AND IMPROVED COOK STOVES ON DRINKING WATER QUALITY AND INDOOR AIR POLUTION: A RANDOMISED CONTROLED TRIAL IN RWANDA

lead_sponsor.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

clinical_study.source: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: LSHTM Research Ethics Committee
Rwanda: National Ethics Committee, Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock: DelAgua Health and Development, Manna Energy and the Rwanda Ministry of Health are collaborating on a project financed by carbon credits that will distribute household-based water filters and high-efficiency cook stoves to approximately 700,000 households in Rwanda. Prior to the full roll out of the campaign, the implementers are conducting a pilot project among 2000 households in western Rwanda. The objectives of this pilot evaluation are to document the delivery of the intervention to the intervention population, assess coverage and uptake of the intervention target households and conduct a 5-month randomised controlled trial among 500 households to assess the impact of the intervention on drinking water quality and indoor air quality.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Thermotolerant coliforms in household drinking water
primary_outcome.description: Faecal contamination levels (thermotolerant coliforms) in household drinking water. Household drinking water quality will be monitored monthly over a 5-month period.

secondary_outcome.description: PM2.5 concentrations measured in reported main cooking area once (24-hour period) in a sub-sample of 120 households.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence - use of water filters and cookstoves
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaires, direct observations and electronic monitoring devices

clinical_study.condition: Faecal Contamination of Household Drinking Water (Environmental Outcome)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Provision of water filters and improved cookstoves
arm_group.description: Households in intervention arm are provided with drinking water filters and improved cook stoves

intervention.intervention_name: Household drinking water filters and cookstoves
intervention.description: The intervention consists of providing households with a household-based drinking water filter (LifestrawÂ® Family version 2.0) and high efficiency cook stoves (Eco Zoom) as well as instructions on how to use them. The intervention is delivered at community level through community health workers (CHWs). Following initial distribution of the products, CHWs visit households fortnightly to reinforce messages about correct and consistent use.
